body.p: The Board noted that many assets are rights that are established by contract, legislation or similar means, for example, financial assets, a lesseeâ€™s rights of use of a leased machine, and many intangible assets, such as patents. It is equally true that ownership of a physical object arises because of rights conferred by law. Furthermore, although they differ in extent, the rights conferred by full legal ownership of a physical object and by a contract to use an object for 99% (or 50% or even 1%) of its useful life are all rights of one kind or another. In addition, because of legal differences or changes, a particular set of rights may constitute full legal ownership in one jurisdiction but not in another jurisdiction, or at one date but not at another date.
